intro: Lotononis tenuis, commonly known as the slender lotononis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like in appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
